subject: Management
title: Parkinson's Law
description: Learn Parkinson's Law in one minute.

hook.text: A report that could take two hours was given a two-week deadline. It took exactly two weeks.

buildup.text: Cyril Parkinson observed: work expands to fill the time available for its completion.

discovery.text: Without constraints, tasks bloat with unnecessary polish, overthinking, and scope creep.

twist.text: Tighter deadlines often produce equal or better quality because they force focus.

climax.text: Set artificial deadlines shorter than your instinct says. Watch how much faster you finish.

punchline.text: Give less time and get more done. Constraints create efficiency.

quiz.question: What does Parkinson's Law state?
options: Work expands to fill the time available for its completion
Shorter deadlines always reduce the quality of work
The more time you give a task, the better the outcome
